Fine champagnes at affordable prices: Le Monde's selection of the best bubbles for the holiday season
subhead: Rémi Barroux, Stéphane Davet, Laure Gasparotto and Sébastien Jenvrin tasted 181 non-vintage champagnes, known as 'brut sans année,' each priced at no more than €50. They selected 81, from both major champagne houses and independent winemakers.

China's industrial-scale pig farms encounter new threats
subhead: After a major outbreak of African swine fever in 2018, China massively industrialized its pig farming sector to ensure food self-sufficiency. This giant factory-style model, which wiped out small farmers, is now threatened by overproduction.

headline: The 2026 FIFA World Cup is shaping up to be 'America first' and, above all, 'business first'
subhead: The World Cup, which will be held in the United States, Canada and Mexico from June 11 to June 27, 2026, will be neither politically neutral, nor financially accessible, nor inclusive. It stands in stark contrast to the principles of grassroots football, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

headline: Beyoncé is now a billionaire, Forbes reports
subhead: The 44-year-old entertainer joins a select club that includes her husband, rapper Jay-Z, as well as Taylor Swift, Bruce Springsteen and Rihanna, according to the publication.

headline: Fight, the innovative agency behind Zohran Mamdani's New York victory
subhead: The mayor-elect owes his resounding victory in part to the political communications agency. Founded after Kamala Harris' defeat in the presidential election, Fight aims to embody the future of the Democratic Party. This renewal is anchored on the left and driven by outsider candidates and creative campaign ads.

subhead: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to meet with US President Donald Trump in Miami on Monday, December 29, Israel has become a source of contention and fantasy within the Trump movement.

headline: Trump, the Apocalypse and King David: A theological reading of the US president
subhead: Since his first term, the American president has frequently made apocalyptic and messianic references. Some supporters compare him to biblical figures such as King David, appealing particularly to evangelical Christians, who make up about one-fifth of Americans.

headline: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhead: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.
